channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report E-2025020002
item.description:
Report E-2025020002

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-05T03:26:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-31
  • City: EDISON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 31, 2025, four (4) 1-gallon pails of paint were damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove all released material from the trailer. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020003
item.description:
Report E-2025020003

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-05T03:26:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-03
  • City: KEARNY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon inspection of the vehicle by a state inspector it was brought to the driver's attention that the tank was leaking, and the driver was directed to place a bucket below the leak, which he did. The incident was observed at the final destination facility prior to unloading. The driver moved the vehicle to the unloading location and unloaded the waste without further incident. The cause of leak was believed to be debris lodged between the door gasket and mating surface allowing liquid to leak out. Subsequent inspection showed no evidence of damage.

item.title: Report E-2025010374
item.description:
Report E-2025010374

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: CARTERET
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer forklift operator hit a drum with the forkblade tip on his forklift slightly puncturing the drum contributing to the unintentional release. Drum was immediately laid on its side and the hole repaired with drum putty. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the repaired punctured drum.

item.title: Report E-2025010369
item.description:
Report E-2025010369

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-03
  • City: EAST BRUNSWICK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9700
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: When unloading freight from trailer forklift operator was carrying the tote on the forkblades of the forklift. As the forklift was transitioning from the trailer to the dock over the dock plate the IBC started to wobble on the forkblades. The forklift operator tried to move forward back on to the trailer and when doing so the IBC fell over causing the lid to partially rupture contributing to the unintentional release. Defensive actions were immediately taken to contain the spilled material and an outside spill response company was dispatched to aid in mitigating and cleaning up the spilled material. The spilled material was cleaned up by an outside company and placed into multiple recovery containers for disposal.
